profileText: A Senator from Michigan; born in Harrison City, Westmoreland County, Pa., February 25, 1889; attended the public schools and the University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa.; graduated from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor in 1913; admitted to the bar the same year and commenced practice in Detroit, Mich.; circuit judge of the circuit court for Wayne County, Mich., 1929-1942; professor of law at Detroit (Mich.) College of Law 1929-1939; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in 1942; reelected in 1948 and served from January 3, 1943, to January 3, 1955; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1954; chairman, Republican Policy Committee (Eighty-third Congress); Ambassador to the Philippines 1955-1956; judge of the United States Court of Military Appeals at Washington, D.C., 1956-1971; served as senior judge on the United States Court of Military Appeals 1971-1976; resident of Grosse Point, Mich., until his death on December 17, 1982; interment in Woodlawn Cemetery, Detroit, Mich.

researchRecord.name: 1939-1976. 26 linear feet and 1 folder [outsize]. Correspondence, photographs, sound recordings and other papers related to his Senate career, especially on committees investigating the national defense program and the attack on Pearl Harbor. Additional files relate to his work as Wayne County one-man jury, 1939-1942; as member of the Hoover Commission; Philippine ambassador; and judge. Finding aid.

Correspondence in Stella Brunt Osborn papers, 1916-1983; Shirley Wheeler Smith papers, 1881-1959; George Murphy papers, 1911-1961; Louis Carlisle Walker papers, 1881-1963; Universities Committee on Post-War International Problems records, 1943-1944; Rudolph Edward Reichart papers, 1907-1962; James Kerr Pollock papers, 1920-1968; Blair Moody papers, 1928-1954; Burke Woods Shartel papers, 1901-1959; John Butlin Martin papers, 1948-1965; Howard Cyrus Lawrence papers, 1916-1966; Fred Warren Green papers, 1881-1939; Frank Dwight Fitzgerald papers, 1928-1944; Michigan Fellowship of Reconciliation papers, 1940-1957; Henry Moore Bates papers, 1886-1950; George Cushing papers, 1942-1955; Owen J. Cleary papers, 1944-1959; Wilber M. Brucker papers, 1877-1968; Emerson R. Boyles papers, 1879-1911 and 1931-1960; Ferdinand Northrup Menefee papers, 1928-1968; Arthur J. Lacy papers, 1891-1975; Wells Ira Bennett papers, 1916-1965; Albert Joseph Engel papers, 1911-1959; and Donald S. Leonard papers, and 1925-1966. Finding aid.
In Arthur Bliss Lane papers, 1904-1957; Charles Parsons papers, 1880-1965; and George Howard Edward Smith papers, 1917-1962.
15 pages. Robert A. Taft Oral History Project. Permission required to cite or reproduce.
In the Clifford J. Durr papers, 1899-1976.
